name: farsightedness
content:
farsightedness noun [U]
(JUDGMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
good judgment about what will happen in the future and the ability to make wise decisions based on this: His diplomacy has lacked farsightedness. The company should be commended for its farsightedness in taking this action. Opposite
shortsightedness
More examplesFewer examplesHe has shown a farsightedness that puts most other politicians to shame. He had the far-sightedness to cast her as Helena in his famous production of A Midsummer Night's Dream.Not every company has the far-sightedness to spot such opportunities.

farsightedness noun [U]
(EYES)
US (UK long-sightedness) the ability to see things clearly that are far away but not clearly see things that are near you: I wear glasses for reading only because of my farsightedness. She had never been tested for farsightedness. Synonym
hyperopiaOpposite
nearsightedness
More examplesFewer examplesLaser surgery can reduce or in many cases eliminate nearsightedness, farsightedness and astigmatism. Patients may experience far-sightedness (hyperopia) and astigmatism.
